instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used on the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea?
Output: In past study, the spectra from leaves of the eight Brassica napus varieties were measured in the visible-near infrared (Vis-NIR) spectra.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used were SNV, deep learning, and Savitzky-Golay.

instruction: What metric was chosen for the discrimination of Brassica napus varieties and how accurate was it?
Output: The metric chosen for the discrimination of Brassica napus varieties was classification accuracy. The maximum classification accuracy achieved in past study was up to 98.2%.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in combination with visible-near infrared (Vis-NIR) spectroscopy for the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea?
Output: The machine learning models used in combination with visible-near infrared (Vis-NIR) spectroscopy for the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea were the support vector machine (SVM) and multiple chemometric methods.

instruction: Can the combination of standard normal variate and support vector machine be used in past study on the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea?
Output: Yes, the combination of standard normal variate and support vector machine can be used in past study on the discrimination of eight Brassica napus varieties in Korea. When using multiple preprocessing and chemometric methods for discrimination, the maximum classification accuracy was achieved with the combination of standard normal variate and support vector machine, reaching up to 98.2%. Therefore, this combination was found to be effective in distinguishing between the different Brassica napus varieties in past study.
